name: Create New Skill from Task Description
prompt: I frequently help users analyze Excel spreadsheets - calculating totals, creating pivot tables, and generating charts. Create a Skill for this so Claude knows how to handle spreadsheet analysis tasks.
expectations: Creates proper YAML frontmatter with name and description
Description is specific and includes trigger keywords (Excel, spreadsheets, charts)
SKILL.md contains concrete examples with code
Keeps content under 500 lines or splits into reference files

name: Improve Verbose Skill Description
prompt: Review this Skill description: 'This is a skill that helps you when you want to work with PDF files and need to do things like extracting text or maybe filling forms and stuff like that.' Make it better following best practices.
expectations: Includes trigger keywords (PDF, extract, forms, documents)
Specifies both what it does AND when to use it
Examples: 'Extracts text and tables from PDF files, fills forms. Use when working with PDFs or when user mentions document extraction.'

name: Add Progressive Disclosure to Long Skill
prompt: I have a Skill with 800 lines in SKILL.md covering: basic queries, advanced joins, performance optimization, and debugging. Reorganize it using progressive disclosure patterns.
expectations: Keeps SKILL.md under 500 lines with high-level overview
Splits content into separate files (ADVANCED.md, PERFORMANCE.md, DEBUGGING.md)
Uses proper linking in SKILL.md to reference files
Keeps references one level deep (no nested references)
Provides table of contents in longer reference files
Explains when to read each reference file

name: Create Evaluation Test Cases
prompt: Create 3 evaluation test cases for a git-commit-helper skill that analyzes diffs and generates commit messages.
expectations: Each evaluation has: query, expected_behavior array
Expected behaviors are concrete and verifiable
Expected behaviors focus on outputs, not internal process
Can be used to measure skill effectiveness

name: Add Workflow with Validation Loop
prompt: I have a Skill for editing XML in Word documents, but users often create invalid XML. Add a workflow with proper validation feedback loops.
expectations: Implements feedback loop (validate → fix → validate again)
Uses 'ONLY proceed when validation passes' language
Provides checklist format for tracking progress
Explains what to do when validation fails

name: Refactor Inconsistent Terminology
prompt: This Skill uses 'endpoint', 'URL', 'API route', and 'path' interchangeably. Also mixes 'retrieve', 'fetch', 'get', and 'pull' for the same operation. Fix the terminology.
expectations: Chooses one term for each concept
Maintains consistency in examples and descriptions

name: Write Utility Script with Error Handling
prompt: Create a utility script for the Skill that validates JSON configuration files. It should handle missing files, invalid JSON, and missing required fields gracefully.
expectations: Creates Python script with proper error handling

name: Fix Time-Sensitive Information
prompt: This Skill says: 'If using before March 2025, use the v1 API. After March 2025, use v2 API.' Rewrite to avoid time-sensitive information.
expectations: Uses 'Current method' section for v2 API
Uses 'Old patterns' or collapsible section for v1
Marks v1 as deprecated with deprecation date
Keeps historical context available but not prominent
Explains why to use v2 over v1

name: Set Appropriate Degrees of Freedom
prompt: I have three tasks in my Skill: (1) database migration (critical, must follow exact steps), (2) data analysis (varies by context), (3) code review (multiple valid approaches). Set appropriate degrees of freedom for each.
expectations: Database migration: Low freedom - exact script, no modifications
Data analysis: Medium freedom - template with parameters
Code review: High freedom - general guidelines and heuristics
Uses analogy of 'narrow bridge' vs 'open field'
Provides specific instructions for low-freedom tasks
Provides general guidance for high-freedom tasks

name: Organize Domain-Specific Content
prompt: My BigQuery Skill covers finance metrics, sales data, product analytics, and marketing campaigns. Currently everything is in one 600-line file. Organize it better.
expectations: Explains when to use each domain file

name: Write Template Pattern
prompt: Create a template for API response format that must be followed strictly - it's for a production API that clients depend on.
expectations: Uses strong language: 'ALWAYS use this exact template'
Explains this is for strict requirements
No flexibility language like 'adapt as needed'

name: Add Examples Pattern
prompt: My Skill generates commit messages but quality is inconsistent. Add examples to improve output quality.
expectations: Examples cover different scenarios (feat, fix, chore)
Shows both input and complete output
Examples demonstrate desired style and detail level

name: Convert Nested References to One Level
prompt: My Skill has this structure: SKILL.md → advanced.md → details.md → examples.md. Flatten it to one level deep.
expectations: Restructures so all files link directly from SKILL.md
Explains why one level is better

name: Add Table of Contents to Long Reference
prompt: My API_REFERENCE.md file is 250 lines. Add a proper table of contents at the top.
expectations: Creates table of contents at very top of file
Enables Claude to see full scope
Useful for partial file reads (head command)

name: Write Conditional Workflow
prompt: My Skill handles both creating new documents and editing existing ones. Add conditional workflow to guide Claude through the decision.
expectations: Creates decision point at start of workflow
Provides clear criteria for each path
References appropriate tools for each path
Explains when to use which workflow
